    • perform_pawn_operation

      public int perform_pawn_operation​(java.lang.String source_point_pawn, java.lang.String target_point)
      So since the first operation of pawn is pretty complex, therefore we separate it from the normal move of other pieces. The function below will check if it's the first move of the pawn, the possible move of the pawn and also perform the move of the pawn
      Parameters:
      source_point_pawn - is the location where the pawn stated
      target_point - is it's the destination that player's instruction ask for
      Returns:
      it will return if the pawn is passant(which mean it's the first move) anymore or not

    • canMoveMax

      public int canMoveMax​(char piece)
      this part is check the maximum move of the piece, since the rook, bishop and queen can move all the way to the edge of the chessboard
      Parameters:
      piece - is read in the chess piece
      Returns:
      7 if the piece is R\B\Q or 1 otherwise

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds​(int x, int y)
      Check if the player's instruction is going to move the piece out of the chessboard
      Parameters:
      x - is the location of piece in X-axis
      y - is the location of piece in y-axis
      Returns:
      true if it's a valid in boundary or false otherwise

    • swapChessPiece

      public ChessPiece swapChessPiece​(int source_x, int source_y, int target_x, int target_y)
      As it was already explain by it's name swap two chess pieces, mostly used in castling since we need to swap the location of king and rook
      Parameters:
      source_x - the X-axis of piece 1
      source_y - the Y-axis of piece 1
      target_x - the X-axis of piece 2
      target_y - the Y-axis of piece 2
      Returns:
      the chess pieces that were moved

    • canDefenderProtectKingFromEnemy

      public boolean canDefenderProtectKingFromEnemy​(java.util.ArrayList<ChessPiece> activePieces_sameKingColor, java.util.ArrayList<Point> enemies)
      This function is used when the king is in checkmate, check if there is any pieces can get rid of the enemy piece that cause the check of the king, otherwise the player need to move the king or it's already checkmate
      Parameters:
      activePieces_sameKingColor - the list of active piece and check each of them to see if any of there possible move can captured the threatening enemy piece
      enemies - the list of the enemy pieces that cause the check of the king
      Returns:
      it will return true if there are some piece that can captured enemy pieces to end the check of the king or false otherwise

    • isKingInCheckMate

      public int isKingInCheckMate​(java.util.ArrayList<ChessPiece> activePieces_oppositeKingColor, java.util.ArrayList<ChessPiece> activePieces_sameKingColor, ChessPiece king)
      This function is check if the move of chess piece make opponent's king in check, checkmate, stalemate or nothing. We will first check the possible move of enemy pieces to see if it will cause the check, if it's true, we will call the function canDefenderProtectKingFromEnemy. If canDefenderProtectKingFromEnemy return false, we will check if there are any possible move that king can do to avoid the check. However we also need to check the friendly pieces to make sure the position that king is going to move to is unoccupied. Finally, if all the checks above are failed, we will return the checkmate and the game is going to end. Meanwhile, even if the king is not in check, it's still possible for king be in stalemate, which it can move to nowhere but stay. So we also check stalemate here since we already read in the list of enemy and friendly pieces.
      Parameters:
      activePieces_oppositeKingColor - is the list of enemy pieces on the board
      activePieces_sameKingColor - is the list of friendly pieces on the board
      king - is king
      Returns:
      the stats of the game

    • getChessPieceInBoard

      public java.util.ArrayList<Point> getChessPieceInBoard​(char color, char piece)
      This function is used to find the piece on the chessboard and put them in a list
      Parameters:
      color - is the color of targeted piece
      piece - is the type of targeted piece
      Returns:
      a list that contain targeted pieces

    • isMoveCastle

      public int isMoveCastle​(ChessPiece king, java.lang.String move)
      This function is used to implement castle since castle is the only case the chesspiece swap with each others
      Parameters:
      king - is king
      move - is the destination of the king
      Returns:
      if 1 if the king is going to swap with the rook on the right, -1 if the king is going to swap with the rook and left and 0 if it's an error

    • canKingCastle

      public boolean canKingCastle​(ChessPiece king)
      Since there are many restriction of castling, for example if it's the first move of king or is there anything between king and rook this function is used to check the availability of king castling.
      Parameters:
      king - is king
      Returns:
      true if king can castle or false if there are some requirement not met

    • game_status

      public int game_status​(int doesMoveResultInCheck)
      This funciton is used to check if the move of piece cause the check and call the isKingInCheckMate function
      Parameters:
      doesMoveResultInCheck - is used to check whose move make other's king in check
      Returns:
      the status of game

    • play_move

      public int play_move​(java.lang.String source_point, java.lang.String target_point, java.lang.String promote)
      This function is where the move of pieces is performed. It check if the instructions of the players folloing the rule and restriction. It also include the feature of the promotion of pawns.
      Parameters:
      source_point - is the original postion of the piece
      target_point - is the destination of the piece
      promote - is the string present which piece is the pawn going to be promote to
      Returns:
      invalid if player implement a bad instruction or the game stats

    • performKingCastle

      public boolean performKingCastle​(ChessPiece king, java.lang.String target_point, int isCastleMove)
      Here is where really perform the castling
      Parameters:
      king - is king
      target_point - is the destination of the king
      isCastleMove - check if it's the first move or not
      Returns:
      false if castling failed or true otherwise

    • typesOfDirections

      public int[][] typesOfDirections​(char piece, int moved)
      Here is the direction rule of chesspiece
      Parameters:
      piece - is the type of piece
      moved - is specifically for pawn and king to check if it's there first move or not
      Returns:
      a 2d-array that represent the direction which piece can move

    • possibleMoves

      public java.util.ArrayList<Point> possibleMoves​(ChessPiece piece, int howToHandleBlockingPieces)
      Here is used to check the possible move of a specific chess piece, mostly used for checking the game stats such as check/checkmate/stalemate
      Parameters:
      piece - is the type of piece
      howToHandleBlockingPieces - is used to when piece meet obstacle on their way to possible move postions
      Returns:
      a list of possible reachable locations of the piece

    • isPieceOnFifthRank

      public boolean isPieceOnFifthRank​(ChessPiece piece)
      This function is for a special case named is piece, which mean that there is a pawn between two opponent pawns. In this case, that pawn will be captured. So the following code is going to check if the target WHITE pawn is in such situation
      Parameters:
      piece - the target WHITE pawn
      Returns:
      true if it is piece

    • isPieceOnFourthRank

      public boolean isPieceOnFourthRank​(ChessPiece piece)

      Parameters:
      piece - the target BLACK pawn
      Returns:
      true if it is piece
